metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25775 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper access control in the Intel(R) Ethernet Controller RDMA driver for linux before version 1.9.30 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via network access. Ivan D Barrera, Christopher Bednarz, Mustafa Ismail, and Shiraz Saleem discovered that the InfiniBand RDMA driver in the Linux kernel did not properly check for zero-length STAG or MR registration. A remote attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-89.99
linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-89.99
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-89.99
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic-64k - 5.15.0-89.99
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1050-aws - 5.15.0-1050.55
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1016-aws - 6.2.0-1016.16~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-89.99').
